resources.string:
Welcome to GreenTips!
 
This application was developed by 6 students at Chalmers Tekniska Högskola in Gothenburg, Sweden.
 
With the tips and ideas we give to you here, we will help you to reduce you environmental impact and live a healthier life!
 
Simply choose the category you are interested in and we will supply many, simple ways for a greener life. 
Receive notifications for reminders by choosing to have a tip in focus!

Walk for short trips 

Walking helps reduce body fat, lower blood pressure and is free. It may also take less time than you think.


Studies have shown that most people will underestimate time related to car journeys and overestimate the time it will take to walk. 

The average walking pace is six kilometres per hour and if you walk you don’t need to find a car bay when you arrive.

Opt for the bike 

Switching a 10km journey per week from your car to your bike will burn around 300 calories each way and can save over 300kg of greenhouse gas emissions each year. 

Did you know? Peak hour city trips up to 10km in length are generally faster by bike than any other form of transport, door to door. 

In addition cycling helps reducing body fat, which is a first step to become healthier and stronger!

Use public transport 

Using public transport allows you to skip the hassle of traffic and parking and still be on time!

Plan before taking trips 

Collect your errands in one trip to save fuel, money and time! 

It will allow you to become more productive during the rest of the day.

Switch to Green driving 

Drive smoothly, starting and stopping uses more fuel. 

Slow down, driving at 90 km/h uses 25% less fuel than travelling at 110 km/h. 

Regularly check your tyre pressure. Under-inflated tyres can increase fuel consumption by 3% and take 10,000km off the tyres life. 

Instead of using the air conditioner open the window when driving under 70km/h.

Take one car 

Instead of taking several cars to make the same trip with your friends, take a single car whenever it is possible. 

You will enjoy your trip even more and it allows you to switch seats with the driver to make your travel safer and more comfortable. 

You can always opt for car-pooling if travelling alone to break the monotony of your daily commute.

Save your money 

Having a car costs a lot nowadays, the fuel is pretty expensive and the congestion tax in Sweden becomes more expensive every year so think twice before buying your own car!
Use cold water when washing your clothes
Turn off lights when you leave the room

Stop using disposable bags


Get some reusable bags or make your own — they’re insanely easy to make.

Use cold water when washing your clothes 

An estimated 75 to 90 percent of all the energy your washer uses goes to warming up the water, so switching to colder water can lower your gas or electric bill. 

In addition hot water will actually set stains, and cold water will get your clothes just as clean.

Make your own cleaning products 

Replace all your plastic chemical containers with a single one. 

*Window cleaner: 1/4 cup of white vinegar, 2 cups of warm water and tea tree oil 

*Anti-bacterial cleaner: 1/4 cup of white vinegar, 1 tbsp of baking soda, 1 litre of hot water and orange essential oils

Insulate your home 

Homes that aren't well insulated are much harder to keep warm when it's cold, and cool when the weather is hot.

Turn off lights when you leave the room 

This is surely one of the most know tips you can hear from anyone. Turning the lights off when you're not using them can help save money by reducing your electricity bills and extend the life of your light bulbs. 

Doing so can make your home more energy-efficient.

Eat less meat 

Not having red meat, even if it’s just for two or three days a week - can have quite a significant impact on reducing your carbon footprint.

Recycle everything 

You can recycle almost everything, from batteries to paper to cars. Before you throw it away, take a minute to find out if you could recycle it instead.

Recycle!


A lot of employees don't care about recycling, but it does matter recycling during your work. You can recycle paper, plastic and food for example.

Go paperless!


Switch to digital documents instead of paper, and think over of buying 100€ recycled paper.

Green cleansing


Many cleansing products are environmentally unfriendly and are dangerous for the environment as well as human health. 

Prioritize buying eco friendly hand soap and sprays that don't have harmful and other bad chemicals.

No more water bottles


You can easily drink water from your own glass, or if you decide to purchase a reusable water bottle.

Plan you work day


Prepare your meals and snacks the day before you work, so you don't need to drive to buy food or other stuff.

Use public transport


The best solution to reduce emissions is to use public transport, and if it's not possible then take your bike and cycle to work.

Have green decoration


Upgrade your office by decorating it with plants. 

The plants gives you oxygen and remove the carbon dioxide. That helps you to get healthier air in your office and add a beautiful design.

Buy Eco friendly clothes


Ask the store if their clothes are made eco friendly.

Be more vegan outside


Be vegan whenever you can. When you eat in restaurants, don't waste food, try to eat less meat, and eat ecologist food.

Buy vintage


Support second hand, buy vintage clothes and used furniture instead of new.

Eat locally produced food


Eat Swedish food. Imported food contributes to environmental degradation.

Save water


Try to save as much water as possible in your daily routine. 

Drink crane water instead of bottled one, and if you don't have access to clean crane water try to buy a filter which will make it clean. It will also save you a lot of money.

Say no to plastic straw


Drink with paper straw instead of plastic. You can also avoid drinking with a straw at all. 
Why would you even need one?

Use containers 

Throw your old clothes in containers so they reuse them instead of burning them.
Do not throw rubbish on the ground
Do not smoke in public places

Be careful what you burn


Avoid burning aluminum cans and other stuff that can release pollutants into the air. 

You should also be careful when you light the fire, make sure that you are allowed to do that and there aren't any local fire bans due to serious drought conditions.

Keep water clean 

Artificial things like makeup, suntan oils can make the local water source unclean. 

Replace using chemical insect repellent with an effective natural product.

Earth-Friendly Outdoor Lighting


Outdoor lighting is actually one of the easiest steps to make when it comes to creating a green living space, because solar-powered outdoor lights are widely available and can be purchased at nearly any garden center or home store. 

Make sure you purchase all-natural options that are made from soy wax or beeswax and scented with essential oils

Do not throw rubbish on the ground 

Some kinds of rubbish have an impressively long decomposition time. 

Especially do not throw batteries which can have a very bad effect on nature, and should be recycled. 

Birds can get stuck on chewing gum on the ground on the street, and that can lead to them getting hit by cars. Another well known consequence of throwing rubbish (in the oceans) are seals getting trapped in plastic rubbish and very often dying because of it.

Do not smoke in public places 

Smoking affects both the environment and people's health in a negative way. 

Studies have shown that tobacco production causes forest losses, and this causes the amount of carbon dioxide to increase in the atmosphere

Stop using hair spray 

Hair spray and other perfumed products have negative consequences for the environment. The perfumes are not broken down but many continue into the waterways, which makes an unnecessary burden on the treatment plants.

Greener Grilling and Outdoor 

Grilling is an integral part of outdoor living, so you probably want to make sure you select a grill that is as safe as possible for your family members and friends. 

Some examples of the best green grilling options available: Charcoal Grill, Corn Grill and Natural Gas
